head.title: The Unread Book: Good Intentions Count, Too

hedline.hl1: The Unread Book: Good Intentions Count, Too

abstract.p: Robert Stein letter comments on July 15 article on best-selling books that are seldom read

block.p: There may be a more benign explanation than intellectual pretension for unread best sellers (''Let Us Now Praise Books Well Sold, Well Loved but Seldom Read,'' Arts & Ideas pages, July 15).
There may be a more benign explanation than intellectual pretension for unread best sellers (''Let Us Now Praise Books Well Sold, Well Loved but Seldom Read,'' Arts & Ideas pages, July 15).

Even books on less weighty matters (better relationships, dieting, investing well and organizing clutter) are bought as promises of self-improvement that often fail to persist through the final chapter. As with New Year's resolutions on the calendar, the impetus may not survive the turning of all the pages, but there is nothing shameful in the impulse or the effort.
